issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
DNS is not case sensitive.  The correct behaviour on the web-services side would be to treat the HTTP Host header as forcibly lower-cased.

For example if {{LoadBalancing}} is used instead of {{loadbalancing}} like in this {{eucarc}} diff:
{code}
10c10
< export AWS_ELB_URL=http://loadbalancing.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com:8773/
---
> export AWS_ELB_URL=http://LoadBalancing.hp-aw2-1.hpcloudsvc.com:8773/
{code}

Then signature verification fails, like so:
{code}
[discover@ops-aw2az3-eucaclc0001 admin]$ source eucarc
[discover@ops-aw2az3-eucaclc0001 admin]$ eulb-describe-lbs
[discover@ops-aw2az3-eucaclc0001 admin]$ source eucarc.test
[discover@ops-aw2az3-eucaclc0001 admin]$ eulb-describe-lbs
eulb-describe-lbs: error (403 Forbidden): Signature validation failed
{code}
fields.summary: DNS names are treated as case sensitive in HTTP Host headers

comments.body:
This works in 4.2 with recent euca2ools (so using signature v4), likely a signature v2 specific issue.

{code}
#
# export AWS_ELB_URL=http://LoadBalancing.d-39.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/
#
#
# eulb-describe-lbs
#
#
# eulb-describe-lbs --version
euca2ools 3.2.0-39-g282073f (Yokohama)
eucalyptus 4.2.0
#
#
{code}

This is fixed in the master branch for 4.2. Tested using a euca2ools client modified to use version 2 signatures:

{code}
# eulb-describe-lbs --debug
2015-05-20 13:40:04,389 DEBUG   DescribeLoadBalancers parsed arguments: {'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'region': None, 'show_long': False, 'show_empty_fields': False, 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'LoadBalancerNames.member': []}
2015-05-20 13:40:04,390 INFO    Config finding global option default-region
2015-05-20 13:40:04,390 INFO    Config   novalue for default-region
2015-05-20 13:40:04,390 INFO    Config finding global option max-retries
2015-05-20 13:40:04,390 INFO    Config   novalue for max-retries

2015-05-20 13:40:04,390 INFO    Config   novalue for timeout

2015-05-20 13:40:04,390 DEBUG   DescribeLoadBalancers sending flattened params as form data

2015-05-20 13:40:04,400 DEBUG   QueryHmacV2Auth b64-encoded signature: oKzN0x9KQXUy62YuW4hrAwgbMqWE3v9iYnfv8le8GC8=
2015-05-20 13:40:04,400 DEBUG   ELB request method: POST

2015-05-20 13:40:04,400 DEBUG   ELB request header: Content-Length: 221

2015-05-20 13:40:04,400 DEBUG   ELB request data:   Action: DescribeLoadBalancers
2015-05-20 13:40:04,400 DEBUG   ELB request data:   Signature: oKzN0x9KQXUy62YuW4hrAwgbMqWE3v9iYnfv8le8GC8=

<DescribeLoadBalancersResponse xmlns="http://elasticloadbalancing.amazonaws.com/doc/2012-06-01/"><DescribeLoadBalancersResult><LoadBalancerDescriptions/></DescribeLoadBalancersResult><ResponseMetadata><RequestId>fb6cbd00-3a22-453d-93b0-fdb552cdeb59::7782ac70-3a24-4233-9881-77af8e6349c2</RequestId></ResponseMetadata></DescribeLoadBalancersResponse>
2015-05-20 13:40:04,590 DEBUG   DescribeLoadBalancers -- end of response content --
{code}

Leaving this for scrub in case we want to backport the fix to 4.1.x.
To verify use a host with some upper case letters and a signature version 2 request.
[~sjones], could you provide either the instructions for modifying the client to use version 2 signatures, or suggest an alternative approach if such would be considered acceptable?
[~jcarroll], you could use an older version of euca2ools to verify the fix.

My local machine: {code}[root@odc-c-12 EUCA-10848]# euca-version euca2ools 3.1.2 (Omega) eucalyptus 4.0.2 {code} I then pulled down admin.zip from 10.111.5.1 to my machine and set it up in its own dir. My modified eucarc: {code}[root@odc-c-12 EUCA-10848]# diff eucarc eucarc.orig 2c2 < export EC2_URL=http://COMpuTE.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --- > export EC2_URL=http://compute.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ 10c10 < export AWS_ELB_URL=http://LOADbalANCing.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ --- > export AWS_ELB_URL=http://loadbalancing.h-01.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/ {code} after which I sourced eucarc and proceeded to test. {code}euca-describe-instances --debug{code} validation: above. So when using euca2ools 3.1.2 ("SignatureVersion: 2") and mixed upper/lowercase HTTP host headers, it appears that this issue has been fixed.
When using euca2ools 3.1.2 and mixing upper/lowercase HTTP host headers, the response is behaving as expected.

worklogs.comment: When using euca2ools 3.1.2 and mixing upper/lowercase HTTP host headers, the response is behaving as expected.
